com.salesforce.androidsdk.rest

Class RestClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.androidsdk.rest.RestClient

  • public class RestClient
extends java.lang.Object
    RestClient allows you to send authenticated HTTP requests to a force.com server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestClient

        public RestClient(RestClient.ClientInfo clientInfo,
                  java.lang.String authToken,
                  HttpAccess httpAccessor,
                  RestClient.AuthTokenProvider authTokenProvider)
        Constructs a RestClient with the given clientInfo, authToken, httpAccessor and authTokenProvider. When it gets a 401 (not authorized) response from the server:
        • If authTokenProvider is not null, it will ask the authTokenProvider for a new access token and retry the request a second time.
        • Otherwise it will return the 401 response.
        Parameters:
        clientInfo -
        authToken -
        httpAccessor -
        authTokenProvider -

    • Method Detail

      • clearCaches

        public static void clearCaches(UserAccount userAccount)
        Remove cached OkHttpClient.Builder, OkHttpClient and OAuthRefreshInterceptor for the given user

      • clearCaches

        public static void clearCaches()
        Clear caches of org-id/user-id to OkHttpClient.Builder, OkHttpClient and OAuthRefreshInterceptor

      • setOkHttpClient

        public void setOkHttpClient(OkHttpClient okHttpClient)
        Sets the OkHttpclient associated with this user account. The OkHttpclient are cached in a map and reused as and when a user account switch occurs, to prevent multiple threads being spawned unnecessarily.

      • setClientInfo

        public void setClientInfo(RestClient.ClientInfo clientInfo)
        Set the client info. Used by clients to implement Login As
        Parameters:
        clientInfo - The new client info to set

      • sendAsync

        public Call sendAsync(RestRequest restRequest,
                      RestClient.AsyncRequestCallback callback)
        Send the given restRequest and process the result asynchronously with the given callback. Note: Intended to be used by code on the UI thread.
        Parameters:
        restRequest -
        callback -
        Returns:
        okHttp Call object (through which you can cancel the request or get the request back)

      • sendSync

        public RestResponse sendSync(RestRequest restRequest)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Send the given restRequest synchronously and return a RestResponse Note: Cannot be used by code on the UI thread (use sendAsync instead).
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public RestResponse sendSync(RestRequest restRequest,

        interceptors - Interceptor(s) to add to the network client before making the request
